com.qualcomm.robotcore.util

Class SoftwareVersionWarningSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.SoftwareVersionWarningSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener, GlobalWarningSource

    public class SoftwareVersionWarningSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements GlobalWarningSource, android.content.SharedPreferences.OnSharedPreferenceChangeListener
    This class is only used on the Robot Controller

      • getGlobalWarning

        public java.lang.String getGlobalWarning()
        Description copied from interface: GlobalWarningSource
        Returns the current warning associated with this warning source. If the source currently has no warning to contribute, it should return null or an empty string.
        Specified by:
        getGlobalWarning in interface GlobalWarningSource
        Returns:
        the current warning associated with this warning source

      • shouldTriggerWarningSound

        public boolean shouldTriggerWarningSound()
        Description copied from interface: GlobalWarningSource
        Returns true if the current warning (if any) is severe enough to warrant playing a warning sound. If the source has no critical warning, this should return false. If getGlobalWarning() returns null or a blank string, the value returned here will be ignored.
        Specified by:
        shouldTriggerWarningSound in interface GlobalWarningSource

      • suppressGlobalWarning

        public void suppressGlobalWarning(boolean suppress)
        Description copied from interface: GlobalWarningSource
        Suppress or de-suppress the contributions of warnings by this source. If warnings are suppressed, GlobalWarningSource.getGlobalWarning() will always return an empty string. Internally, a supression count is maintained which is incremented if 'suppress' is true and decremented if it is false. The initial value of the count is zero; suppression is in effect if the count is greater than zero.
        Specified by:
        suppressGlobalWarning in interface GlobalWarningSource
        Parameters:
        suppress - whether to suppress or desupress warnings associated with this source
        See Also:
        GlobalWarningSource.clearGlobalWarning()

      • setGlobalWarning

        public void setGlobalWarning(java.lang.String warning)
        Description copied from interface: GlobalWarningSource
        Sets the current warning associated with this warning source, if permitted to do so by the source. Sources may refuse for various reasons: perhaps they only ever produce their warnings from internal state, or perhaps they don't accept another warning if a first has already been set.
        Specified by:
        setGlobalWarning in interface GlobalWarningSource
        Parameters:
        warning - the warning to be associated with this sources
        See Also:
        GlobalWarningSource.clearGlobalWarning()

      • clearGlobalWarning

        public void clearGlobalWarning()
        Description copied from interface: GlobalWarningSource
        Clears any currently set warning (if permitted) for this source, and zeros the sources suppression count.
        Specified by:
        clearGlobalWarning in interface GlobalWarningSource
        See Also:
        GlobalWarningSource.setGlobalWarning(String)
